concept.title: Changing cell content
concept.shortdesc: The contents of a cell can be modified when the cell is in editing mode.

conbody.p: The data in a cell can be edited in one of the following ways:

ul.li: Double click the cell. The cursor will be placed in the middle of the cell and the content can be edited directly within the cell.
Select the cell and press F2. The cursor will be placed at the end of the cell content and the content can be edited.
Select the cell and click in the formula bar on the place where you want to start editing.

conbody.p: When the cell is in editing mode, the mode on the status bar (bottom left) has been changed from Ready to Edit. To the left of the formula bar two new icons appear: . The left one for Cancel and the next for Enter.
conbody.note: The operation must be terminated with the Enter button to change the mode in Ready.
